commitResults.messageTitle: Increment Duke to Level-1
commitResults.messageBody:
Recustomize the chatbot name.
Add basic echo behavior indicated by the level requirement.
Recustomize the chatbot text UI.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add a todo class to store the todo items
Todo: change from accessing from class to accessing from instances
Increment Lihua to Level 2
commitResults.messageBody: Using Todo class to complete the functionality in Lihua.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Integrate a new Item class representing tasks into the application
Refactor Todo class name to make more sense
Integrate get done feature to Item and Todos
Add a class providing methods to check format of input
Add handling for index out of bound exception for the feature of getting things done.
Fix typo in message to print out
Add get done feature to main program
Refactor with more reasonable names
Add 3 new Task's children classes
Update documentation for 3 Task classes
Update/Add helper class for user input checking and extracting
Add task adding methods in Tasks class
Add print functionality for 3 task adding
Fix bug (add error handling for format checking)
Formatting code
Use polymorphism to reduce repetitive code
Add text ui testing scripts
Add handling for wrong/missing argument of 'done'
Add exception handling, increment to level 5
Add additional testing scripts for level 5
Add a help command with Enumeration of commands
Add save functionality using JSON Simple
commitResults.messageBody:
The task bot can only save the tasks temporarily.

A user would expect his/her tasks to be stored permanently, so that he/she can retrieve the tasks in the future.

Let's update Lihua so that the tasks can be stored in hard disk and loaded later.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add strict date formatting for deadline
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadline accepts all forms of string as initialization input.

Some meaningless inputs may be accepted, e.g. deadline /by haha.

Let's update the Deadline class and propagate the changes to let
deadline accepts only 'yyyy-mm-dd' format dates.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add strict date formatting for event
commitResults.messageBody:
Event accepts all forms of string as initialization input.

Some meaningless inputs may be accepted, e.g. event /at haha.

Let's update the Event class and propagate the changes to let
event accepts only 'yyyy-mm-dd' format dates.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality to list tasks on a specific date
commitResults.messageBody:
The date associated with a task (if applicable) is only a record with no
utility.

User would expect a function to search tasks by date.

Let's implement this function and propogate changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug related to date parsing
commitResults.messageBody:
The time field of JSON object for ToDo object is set to be an empty
string.

Calling LocalDate.parse("") would result in an exception.

Let's update the implementation so that the `LocalDate.parse()` will not
be called for ToDo objects.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Storage, Ui components
commitResults.messageBody:
Ui and storage functions are embedded inside other program logic.

This will cause the code to violate OOP standards and become less readable.

Let's integrate Storage and Ui functions into classes of their own.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Command, Parser components
commitResults.messageBody:
Commands are explictly handled. Understanding of command is also explicit.

This would introduce lengthy if-else block as well as repetitive String
split operations, which is not very readable, maintainable, and efficient.

Let's follow [AddressBook Level 2](https://github.com/se-edu/addressbook-level2)
 style and integrate Command and Parser classes into the application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove redundant code
commitResults.messageBody:
The application contains a lot of redundant/unused code after refactoring.

Unsued code reduces readability, and hampers the reasoning of logic.

Let's remove (part of) the redundant code from the project.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor classes to form various packages
commitResults.messageBody:
All classes are inside one directory.

Not easy to classify the classess, thus reducing readability and
hampering modulization.

By dividing classes into packages, the code becomes easier to maintain.

Let's follow a packaging style similer to [address-book level-2](https://github.com/se-edu/addressbook-level2).

commitResults.messageTitle: Delete unused files
commitResults.messageBody:
The four customized exception files have no implementation and are not used.

Unused files hampers readability and clarity of the whole project.

Let's delete the four files. Self-defined exception classes can be done
at a later stage.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create simple JUnit tests on static fileds mainly
commitResults.messageBody:
No JUnit tests are included.

No testing of important fields or methods would result in serious bugs or
unexpected behavior of code.

Let's use JUnit 5.4 to test some of the static fields of classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix index out of bound bug for command 'done'
commitResults.messageBody:
The index is zero-based.

Zero-based indexing may be confusing to non-programmers.

Let's modify the indexing for 'done' so that it is 1-based.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update gradle support
commitResults.messageBody:
The gradle class & dependency name are default.

Default names are not compatible with the project.

Let's update build.gradle so that the dependency and class name are supported.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadoc for all classes
commitResults.messageBody:
No/incomplete javadoc is provided.

Missing javadoc would affect the readability and maintenance of the code.

Let's add javadoc to our application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak the code to follow code standards
commitResults.messageBody:
The code style is mostly correct, with few exceptions because of carelessness.

Making the code style standard is better.

Let's update the style a bit so that the code basically abides the standard.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify welcome and good back emonji
commitResults.messageBody:
The emonji is not displaying properly in windows terminal.

Let's update the emonji so that it gets displayed properly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add find by keyword functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
The application only supports list tasks by time (if applicable).

The user would want to search tasks by name/keyword.

Let's integrate the find by keyword functionality into our application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix issues in regression testing
commitResults.messageBody:
After adding the find functionality, the regression testing fails

Testing failure means potential bugs.

Let's fix the regression testing issue.
